japanese: 今日は彼は授業に遅れたが概して申し分のない生徒です。
english: Today he was late for his class. But he is, on the whole, a satisfactory student.

english: Sales are down this month.

japanese: 今日は暑いから海で泳げるよ。
english: Today is hot enough for us to swim in the sea.

english: Two boys are absent from school today.

english: Today above ground tomorrow under.

japanese: 今日はとても寒いですね。

japanese: 今日はとても寒いね。

japanese: 今日のお昼時間は、いつものレストランは家族のお葬式でお休みだ。
english: At lunchtime today, our usual restaurant was closed because of a funeral in the family.

japanese: 今日ノートを無くしちゃったんだ。
english: I lost my notebook today.

japanese: 今日のオススメは何ですか。
english: What is today's recommendation?

japanese: 今日のあなたはとってもおしゃれ。
english: You're very stylish today.

japanese: 今日のあたしがあるのはひとえに両親のお陰です。
english: I owe what I am solely to both my parents.

japanese: 今日のＤＪは誰ですか。
english: Who's the DJ today?

japanese: 今日のＡＢＣ交響楽団の演奏は期待はずれだった。
english: Today's performance of the ABC Symphony Orchestra fell short of my expectations.

japanese: 今日になってようやく事の詳細を知りました。
english: Only today did I know the details of the matter.

japanese: 今日取りにいらしてください。
english: You can come and get it today.

japanese: 今日どこで昼食する？
english: Where will you have lunch today?

japanese: 今日でも、世界の色々なところに永続的な家を持たない人々の集団が少数存在している。
english: Nowadays, there are still a few groups of people in different parts of the world who do not have permanent homes.

japanese: 今日では、都会の暮らしより田舎の暮らしを好む人がますます多くなっている。
english: Nowadays more and more people prefer country life to city life.

japanese: 今日では大量の紙が毎日消費されている。
english: Today, paper is used in quantity every day.

japanese: 今日では対外関係と国内問題には親密な関係がある。
english: Nowadays there is a close relationship between foreign relations and domestic affairs.

japanese: 今日では人はただ生計を立てるだけでは満足できない。
english: Today you can't be content with just earning a living.

japanese: 今日では審判になるのは容易ではない。
english: It is not easy to be an umpire today.

japanese: 今日では若い人はお年よりの面倒をみない。
english: Nowadays the young take no care of the old.

japanese: 今日では車の値段は広い範囲に渡っている。
english: Cars are now available in a wide range of prices.

japanese: 今日では私たちは天気がどうなるかを高い精度で当てることができる。
english: Today, we can tell how the weather will be with a high degree of accuracy.

japanese: 今日では言論の自由は当然のことと考えられている。
english: Nowadays freedom of speech is taken as a matter of course.

japanese: 今日ではほとんどの家庭にテレビの一台や二台はある。
english: Nowadays, almost every home has one or two televisions.

japanese: 今日ではドイツ語を勉強する学生の数は昔ほどではありません。
english: Fewer students study German today than before.

japanese: 今日ではテレビのない生活なんて想像できない。
english: Today no one can imagine a life without television.

japanese: 今日ではコンピューターの知識があれば有利になる。
english: It is an advantage today to have a knowledge of computers.

japanese: 今日ではお手伝いさんを雇う余裕のある人は少ない。
english: Nowadays few people can afford to employ a maid.

japanese: 今日ではイギリス中に鉄道が走っている。
english: Nowadays there are railways all over England.

japanese: 今日では７０歳以上まで生きる人は多い。
english: Nowadays many people live to be over seventy years old.

japanese: 今日では１９５０年の３倍以上の数の車が走っている。
english: Today we have more than three times as many vehicles as on the roads in 1950.

japanese: 今日では１０％の陸地しか覆われていないのである。
english: Today only 10 percent is covered.

japanese: 今日では、彼女は人間が言語を使ってできることの多くのことができる。
english: Today she can do many things humans can do with language.

japanese: 今日では、通勤者達は交通渋滞を当たり前のことと思っている。
english: Nowadays, commuters take traffic jams for granted.

japanese: 今日では、手作りの商品の値が高い。
english: Handmade goods are very expensive nowadays.

japanese: 今日では、ラジオやテレビを通して、大量広告が何百万もの人々に同時にメッセージを届けている。
english: Today, through radio and television, mass advertising can reach millions of people at a time with its messages.

japanese: 今日では、ますます多くの人がよりよい給料とより高い地位を求めて転職している。
english: Today, more and more people are changing jobs in order to get a better salary and higher social status.

japanese: 今日では、パスポートには写真がなければならない。
english: Today, you must have a photograph in your passport.

japanese: 今日では、サラリーマンでさえ大変な苦難に直面している。
english: Today, even white-collar workers are confronted with great hardships.

japanese: 今日では、きちんとした職業を持ち、夫に経済的に依存する必要がない女性がふえている。
english: More and more women have their own careers and are economically independent of their husbands.

japanese: 今日では、アメリカで世界中のどこへ電報を打つにも電話で通信文を告げるだけでよい。
english: Today, to send a telegram in the States to anywhere in the world, all you have to do is to give the message over the telephone.

japanese: 今日で５日連続の株価下落だ。
english: This is the fifth consecutive day of decline of stock prices.

japanese: 今日できることは明日まで延ばすな。
english: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.

japanese: 今日ではパイロットの疲労の方がずっと多いようだ。
english: Today pilot fatigue seems more likely.

japanese: 今日だけは、議論はよそう。
english: Just for this once, let's not have an argument.

japanese: 今日その仕事を申し込もう。
english: I'll apply for the job today.

japanese: 今日しなければならない宿題がたくさんある。
english: I have a lot of assignments to do today.

japanese: 今日ごみを再利用する大きな運動が見られる。
english: There is a big movement today to recycle trash.

japanese: 今日この番組でハッカーの問題をクローズアップするんだって。
english: This program is going to focus on computer hacking issues today.

japanese: 今日この手紙を出すつもりだよ。
english: I'll mail this letter today.

japanese: 今日から丸１日お願いします。
english: For a full day from today please.

japanese: 今日お訪ねしてもよろしいですか。
english: May I call on you today?

japanese: 今日お気に入りの芸能人が出てるミュージカルを見に行った。彼は、今年の一押しだね。
english: I went to a musical with my favorite actor today. He's the one must-see for this year.

japanese: 今日オゾン層は希薄になりつつある。
english: Today the ozone layer is thinning.

japanese: 今日おいでになったときにお会いできなくて、申し訳ありませんでした。
english: I'm sorry I wasn't able to see you when you came by today.

japanese: 今日いけなくて残念です。
english: I regret that I can't come today.

japanese: 今日はお忙しいですか？
english: Are you busy today?

japanese: 今日あるような産業は、その当時は存在しなかった。
english: Industry as we know it today didn't exist in those days.

japanese: 今日あなたの寝室を掃除します。
english: I'm going to clean your bedroom today.

japanese: 今日あなたといっしょに行けないのが残念だ。
english: I'm sorry I can't go with you today.

japanese: 今日１日、十分に走ったよ。
english: We've driven enough for one day.

japanese: 今日は１０キロ歩いた。
english: Today I walked 10 kilometers.

japanese: 今日、野球の試合を見に行くと、売り子がお湯の入ったタンクを持って、そこいらを歩き回っている。
english: If you go to a baseball game today, sellers are walking around with hot-water tanks.

japanese: 今日、彼は容疑者に接見した。
english: He interviewed the suspect today.

japanese: 今日、彼は実に親切だ。
english: He is being very kind today.

japanese: 今日、日本の若者達が自国の伝統文化にほとんど興味を示さない事は残念である。
english: It is regrettable that young Japanese today should show little interest in the traditional culture of their country.

japanese: 今日、町を見物するつもりだ。
english: I'll look around the city today.

japanese: 今日、誰でも教育は万人の権利だとみなしている。
english: Today everyone regards education as a right for all.

japanese: 今日、多くの人々は、巨大な現代社会においては、重要なことで個人にできることは何もないという気持ちをいだいているように思われる。
english: Many men nowadays seem to have the feeling that in vast modern societies there is nothing of importance that the individual can do.

japanese: 今日、多くの人が高等教育を受けている。
english: Today, many people receive higher education.

japanese: 今日、西ヨーロッパの７人に１人は老人です。
english: Today, one of every seven people in Western Europe is classified as elderly.

japanese: 今日、人間関係を軽視する傾向があるように思える。
english: Today there seems to be a tendency to make little of human relations.

japanese: 今日、小テストがありました。
english: We had a quiz today.

japanese: 今日、車を借りてもいいですか。
english: May I use your car today?

japanese: 今日、辞書を持っていますか。
english: Have you a dictionary today?

japanese: 今日、私たちに考えるべき社会問題が数多くある。
english: We have a lot of social problems to think about today.

japanese: 今日、私は全部で十冊の本を買った。
english: Today, I bought ten books in all.

japanese: 今日、国際情勢に遅れないで付いて行くのは困難である。
english: It is difficult to keep abreast of the international situation these days.

japanese: 今日、気温は摂氏３０度の高さまでも上昇した。
english: Today, the temperature rose as high as 30 degrees Celsius.

japanese: 今日、会社間に合った？
english: Were you on time for work today?

japanese: 今日、我々は歴史上の危機に直面している。
english: Today we stand at a critical point in history.

japanese: 今日、ほとんどの若者はスキーができる。
english: Today most young people can ski.

japanese: 今日、英語の試験があります。
english: We have an examination in English today.

japanese: 今日、がらがらだね。この時間帯って空いているのかね。
english: It's not crowded at all today. This is the least crowded time of all.

japanese: 今度来る時は妹を連れてきます。
english: I'll bring my sister when I come next time.

japanese: 今度来る時には妹を連れて来ます。
english: I'll bring my sister when I come next time.

japanese: 今度来る時には、弟さんを連れて来なさい。
english: When you come next time, bring your brother.

japanese: 今度遊びに来てください。
english: Come and see us sometime.

japanese: 今度郵便局へ行くときこの手紙をポストに入れて下さい。
english: Please mail this letter on your next trip to the post office.

japanese: 今度遊びに来たときに、君にその本を見せましょう。
english: Next time you come to see me, I will show you the book.

japanese: 今度彼女に会われたらよろしくお伝えください。
english: Next time you see her, give her my best wishes.

japanese: 今度彼がいつ来るのかわかりません。
english: I don't know when he'll come again.

japanese: 今度日本に返って来られるのはずっと先のことでしょう。
english: I guess it will be a long time before I can return to Japan.

japanese: 今度東京においでの折にはお立ち寄りください。
english: Drop in and see us when you're next in Tokyo.

japanese: 今度神戸に来たときは、私たちのところによって下さい。
english: Drop in and see us when you're next in Kobe.

japanese: 今度新規ビジネスを始めるんだ。それで物は相談なんだけど、君、一枚噛んでくれないか。
english: We've got some new business coming in and I want to discuss it with you. Do you mind getting involved?

japanese: 今度会うときに返事をください。
english: Next time I see you, please give me your answer.

japanese: 今度また誘ってよ。
english: How about a rain check?

japanese: 今度ロンドンにいらっしゃったときには私たちのところにお立ち寄り下さい。
english: Please drop in to see us next time you come to London.

japanese: 今度また彼女に電話するというならこれっきりよ。
english: If you telephone her again, that'll be the last straw!

japanese: 今度は彼は成功した。
english: This time he has succeeded.

japanese: 今度は妹さんを連れていらっしゃい。
english: Bring your sister next time.

japanese: 今度は彼はくだけた服装をした。美々しいスーツは場違いである事に気がついたからだ。
english: This time he dressed down, having realized that the smart suit would be out of place.

japanese: 今度は罰をまぬがれまい。
english: We'll get it this time.

japanese: 今度は徒歩か自転車でそこに行くつもりです。
english: I will go there on foot or by bicycle next time.

japanese: 今度は失敗しません。
english: This time it does not fail.

japanese: 今度は私の方が彼を訪ねなければならない。
english: I must return his call.

japanese: 今度は私の方が質問された。
english: I was asked a question in my turn.

japanese: 今度は私が質問された。
english: I was asked a question in my turn.

japanese: 今度は私が運転する番よ。
english: It's my turn to drive next.

japanese: 今度は見逃してやるが、またお前を盗みの現行犯で捕らえたくないもんだね。
english: I'll let you off this time, but I don't ever want to catch you stealing again.

japanese: 今度は君のサーブだ。
english: Now it's your serve.

japanese: 今度は君がそこにいかなければならない。
english: This time you must go there.

japanese: 今度は確認し、再確認し、さらにもう一度確認します。
english: This time, I'll check, double-check and check again.

japanese: 今度は何をしようか。
english: What shall I do next?

japanese: 今度は我々が笑う番だ。
english: It is our turn to laugh.

japanese: 今度は何を弾いてくれるんだ。
english: What are you going to play?

japanese: 今度はまずいことが起こらないと本当にいいのですが。
english: I just hope nothing goes wrong this time.

japanese: 今度はどっちが勝っていますか。
english: Which side is winning this time?

japanese: 今度はそれを持ち上げる度胸はとうていないであろう。
english: She just can't have the nerve to lift it up now!

japanese: 今度はがんばります。
english: I'll try not to disappoint you next time.

japanese: 今度はいつ訪ねてくるのか。
english: When will you next visit?

japanese: 今度はあの子は何をねらっているのか。
english: What is the child up to now?

japanese: 今度はあなただけでするべきです。
english: This time you should do it by yourself.

japanese: 今度はあなたが運転する番だ。
english: It's your turn to drive.

japanese: 今度は、私が不利な立場に立っているようだ。
english: It seems that this time I'm the man behind the eight ball.

japanese: 今度の旅行は仕事じゃなくて遊びです。
english: Our next trip is for pleasure, not for work.

japanese: 今度の風邪は軽い。
english: The colds that are about at the moment are not serious.

japanese: 今度の風邪には本当にまいったよ。
english: This cold has knocked me for a loop.

japanese: 今度の風邪が治るのにどうしてこんなに長くかかったのか分からない。
english: I don't know why it took me so long to get over my cold this time.

japanese: 今度の秘書は１分間に７０ワードもタイプが打てる。
english: The new secretary types about 70 words per minute.

japanese: 今度の秘書は有能とは思えない。
english: The new secretary doesn't strike me as efficient.

japanese: 今度の日曜日はどうですか。
english: What about next Sunday?

japanese: 今度の日曜日は家族ピクニックのために空けよう。
english: I'll set aside next Sunday for a picnic with my family.

japanese: 今度の日曜日の１０時半にここを出ます。
english: I leave here at ten-thirty next Sunday.

japanese: 今度の日曜日に弁論大会が開催される。
english: An oratorical contest will be held next Sunday.

japanese: 今度の日曜日に天気が良かったら、葉山にサーフィンに行かないかい？
english: How about going surfing at Hayama next Sunday if it is fine?

japanese: 今度の日曜日に車を乗り回して行けるところまで行こうぜ。
english: This Sunday let's take a joy ride and see where we end up.

japanese: 今度の日曜日に私と魚釣りに行くのを忘れないでね。
english: Remember to go fishing with me this coming Sunday.

japanese: 今度の日曜日に結婚するんです。
english: I'm getting married next Sunday.

japanese: 今度の日曜日に何をするかもう決めましたか。
english: Have you chosen what to do next Sunday yet?

japanese: 今度の日曜日に何か先約がありますか。
english: Do you have any previous appointments next Sunday?

japanese: 今度の日曜日にピクニックに行こうと私たちは彼女に言った。
english: We suggested to her that we should go on a picnic the following Sunday.

japanese: 今度の日曜日にドライブにつれていってくれませんか。
english: Will you take us for a drive next Sunday?

japanese: 今度の日曜日にぜひお越しください。
english: Please come and see me next Sunday by all means.

japanese: 今度の日曜日にスケートを教えてあげよう。
english: I will teach you how to skate next Sunday.

japanese: 今度の日曜日に、私達は学校の近くの丘に登る予定だ。
english: We are going to mount a hill near our school this Sunday.

japanese: 今度の日曜日うちへ来ない？
english: Won't you come to my house next Sunday?

japanese: 今度の日曜ハイキングに行ってもいい？
english: Can I go hiking next Sunday?

japanese: 今度の土曜日はどうですか。
english: How about next Saturday?

japanese: 今度の土曜日の朝、シカゴに向けて出発します。
english: I'm leaving for Chicago next Saturday morning.

japanese: 今度の土曜日、テニスをしませんか。
english: How about playing tennis next Saturday?

japanese: 今度の選挙は棄権するつもりだ。
english: I don't plan to vote at the upcoming election.

japanese: 今度の選挙では与党が勝ちそうだね。
english: The sitting government is likely to win in the coming election.

japanese: 今度の赤ちゃんのお名前、決まりましたか。
english: Have you decided on a name for your new baby?

japanese: 今度の税金は全ての民間企業に適用される。
english: This tax is applied to all private-sector enterprises.

japanese: 今度の水曜日ならいいですよ。
english: Next Wednesday will be fine.

japanese: 今度の水曜日何か予定がありますか。
english: Do you have anything next Wednesday?

japanese: 今度の新人は、チャレンジ精神旺盛でいいね。
english: I like the new guy. He's not afraid to take on challenging work.

japanese: 今度の新しい仕事にジョージはとても熱中している。
english: George is very enthusiastic about his new job.

japanese: 今度の上司？個性的どころか、ありがちなタイプね。
english: The new supervisor? He's not very original - pretty much like the rest.

japanese: 今度の小説は彼の名声をさらに大きく高めた。
english: The new novel added greatly to his reputation.

japanese: 今度の週末には何か約束がありますか。
english: Do you have anything on for this weekend?

japanese: 今度の商売は、損して得取れ、という戦略でやろうよ。
english: In our next line of business let's make it our strategy to win by losing.

japanese: 今度の週末にお宅に泊めていただけませんか。
english: Will you put us up for the weekend?

japanese: 今度の事務員の方が前の事務員よりタイプを打つのが速い。
english: The new secretary types faster than the old one.

japanese: 今度の市長は市民の評判がよい。
english: The new mayor is well spoken of by the citizens.

japanese: 今度の事件で彼を見直した。
english: After the incident I came to have a higher opinion of him.

japanese: 今度の仕事は前の仕事よりもやるべきことが少ない。
english: There's less to do in this job than the last one.

japanese: 今度の仕事の方が前の仕事より厳しい。
english: My new job is harder than my old one.

japanese: 今度の仕事は気に入っていますか？
english: Are you pleased with your new job?

japanese: 今度の祭日は日曜日と重なります。
english: The next holiday falls on a Sunday.

japanese: 今度の月曜日で彼女は入院して１ヶ月になる。
english: She will have been in hospital for a month next Monday.

japanese: 今度の芸術作品で彼女の名声が上がってほっとしている。
english: To my great relief, her new work of art added to her reputation.

japanese: 今度の金曜日までにはこの仕事を終えてしまっているでしょう。
english: I will have finished this task by next Friday.

japanese: 今度の勤め口でしばらく辛抱しなさい。そのうちもっと良いところを見つけてあげます。
english: You must put up with your new post for the present. I'll find you a better place one of these days.

japanese: 今度の協定を三社で承認しあった。
english: This agreement was confirmed by three companies.

japanese: 今度の休みはどこへ行くの？
english: Where are you going for your next vacation?

japanese: 今度の休暇は余り楽しくない。帰った方がいい。
english: This holiday isn't much fun - we should have gone home.

japanese: 今度の学校の方がいいですか。
english: Do you like the new school better?

japanese: 今度の会には出席します。
english: I'll attend the next meeting.

japanese: 今度の夏には上手に泳げるようになるでしょう。
english: You will be able to swim well next summer.

japanese: 今度の英語の試験の成績はよかった。
english: The results for the English exam this time were very good.

japanese: 今度の映画は記録破りの大当たりだった。
english: The new picture has made a record breaking hit.

japanese: 今度のバス旅行に行く？
english: Will you go on the next bus trip?

japanese: 今度のテレビドラマはたいへんおもしろい。
english: The new TV drama is quite interesting.

japanese: 今度のお休み何しようか。
english: What shall we do on your next days off?

japanese: 今度のイベントのアトラクションにはＫ先生が出るんでしょ？楽しみだなあ実に。
english: Prof. K is going to be a major attraction at this event, right? I can hardly wait.

japanese: 今度の３連休には何をしますか。
english: How will you spend the coming three-day holiday?

japanese: 今度ニューヨークに行く時は、必ずそのラジオを買わなければならない。
english: I really must buy that radio next time I am in New York.

japanese: 今度だけは遅刻を大目に見てやろう。
english: I will overlook your lateness this time.

japanese: 今度だけは許してやろう。
english: I will give him another chance.

japanese: 今度だけはスーは時間どおりに会議にやってきた。
english: For once, Sue came to the meeting on time.

japanese: 今度だけはお前の行いを見逃そう。
english: I'll overlook your conduct this time.

japanese: 今度そのスキーツアーに参加したら、５回参加したことになります。
english: I will have joined the ski tour five times when I join it again.

japanese: 今度サンフランシスコを訪れたら、あのホテルに泊まってみたい。
english: Next time I visit San Francisco, I'd like to stay at that hotel.

japanese: 今度こっちに来るときは絶対知らせてくださいね。
english: You must let me know when you come here next time.

japanese: 今度こそは彼女を逃がさないぞ。
english: I will not let her escape this time.

japanese: 今度こそは私が正しい。
english: I am right for once.

japanese: 今度こそはミスをしないようにしよう。
english: I'll try not to make mistakes next time.

japanese: 今度くるときには姉を連れてきます。
english: I'll bring my sister when I come next time.

japanese: 今度来た先生は、先生というより友達みたいだ。
english: The new teacher is more like a friend than a teacher.

japanese: 今度カナダに行くとそこへ二度行くことになる。
english: I'll have visited Canada twice if I go there again.

japanese: 今度あなたの町を訪れるときにはあなたにお会いするのを楽しみにしています。
english: I'm looking forward to meeting with you the next time I visit your town.

japanese: 今度あなたに会えるのは１年後になるだろう。
english: It will be one year before I see you again.

japanese: 今度、埋め合わせするよ。
english: I'll make up for it.

japanese: 今登録されれば、１年間無料です。
english: Join now and pay nothing for a whole year.

japanese: 今禎子にできることは、折り鶴を折って奇跡を願うことだけだった。
english: All Sadako could do now was to make paper cranes and hope for a miracle.

japanese: 今釣ってきた魚を、活き造りにしてもらえますか。
english: Can you make sashimi out of this fish I just caught?

japanese: 今、通りには全く雪がない。
english: The street is free from snow now.

japanese: 今通った家の人をご存知ですか。
english: Do you know the man whose house we have just passed?

japanese: 今直しているところなんだ。
english: So it is being repaired at the moment.

japanese: 今朝夜明け近くに地震があった。
english: There was a weak earthquake toward dawn this morning.

japanese: 今朝目が覚めたとき、空腹感を覚えた。
english: When I awoke this morning, I felt hungry.

japanese: 今朝目がさめたときは両親はもう仕事に出かけていました。
english: When I woke up this morning, both of my parents had gone to work.

japanese: 今朝僕は牛乳をコップ一杯飲んだ。
english: I drank a glass of milk this morning.

japanese: 今朝彼女に何がおきたのですか。
english: What happened to her this morning?

japanese: 今朝天気が大変悪かったので、タクシーに乗らねばならなかった。
english: This morning the weather was so bad that I had to take a taxi.

japanese: 今朝遅刻したのには理由がある。
english: There is a reason to be late this morning.

japanese: 今朝、地面は霜で覆われていた。
english: The ground was covered with frost this morning.

japanese: 今朝地震があった。
english: There was an earthquake this morning.

japanese: 今朝誰かが会いに来ましたよ。
english: Somebody came to see you this morning.

japanese: 今朝雪が降りました。
english: We had snow this morning.

japanese: 今朝車中で思いがけず彼にあった。
english: I met him by chance on the train this morning.

japanese: 今朝車中で偶然彼に会った。
english: I met him by chance on the train this morning.

japanese: 今朝車がこわれて、金曜日まで修理がかかるんです。
english: My car broke down this morning and won't be repaired until Friday.

japanese: 今朝私達が見た男の人はグリーンさんでした。
english: The man we saw this morning was Mr Green.

japanese: 今朝私は国元から父が病気になったという電報を受け取った。
english: This morning I got a telegram from home saying that my father had been suddenly taken ill.

japanese: 今朝私は公園に行った。
english: I went to a park this morning.

japanese: 今朝私は、いとこを見送るために空港に行った。
english: This morning I went to the airport in order to see my cousin off.

japanese: 今朝私が起きたときには、父はもう朝食を済ませていた。
english: My father had already finished breakfast when I got up this morning.

japanese: 今朝交通渋滞で動きがとれなかった。
english: We were stuck in heavy traffic this morning.

japanese: 今朝犬に餌やった？
english: Did you feed the dog this morning?

japanese: 今朝起きてみると、山の頂が雪におおわれていた。
english: I awoke this morning to find the summit of the mountain covered with snow.

japanese: 今朝起きた時、気分がとても悪かった。
english: I awoke this morning feeling very ill.

japanese: 今朝駅で彼を見かけましたか。
english: Did you see him at the station this morning?

japanese: 今朝もいつも乗る電車に間に合わなかった。
english: This morning I missed the train I usually take.

japanese: 今朝ホーキング博士が選んでいた単語はプリントアウトされ、彼ほんの出版社に送られるだろう。
english: The words Dr. Hawking was choosing this morning would be printed out and sent to the publisher of his book.

japanese: 今朝ブラウンさんという人がきました。
english: A Mr Brown came this morning.

japanese: 今朝ピアノ練習をしましたか。
english: Did you practice the piano this morning?

japanese: 今朝ひょっこり旧友に会った。
english: I ran into an old friend of mine this morning.

japanese: 今朝ピアノの練習をしましたか。
english: Did you practice the piano this morning?

japanese: 今朝は歴史の小テストがあった。
english: We had a history quiz this morning.

japanese: 今朝は零度以下でしたが、自転車で学校へ行きました。
english: It was below zero this morning, but I cycled to school.

japanese: 今朝は零下３度だった。
english: The thermometer stood at three degrees below zero this morning.

japanese: 今朝は涼しいですね。
english: It's cool this morning, isn't it?

japanese: 今朝は郵便がたくさんきた。
english: I got a lot of mail this morning.

japanese: 今朝は風が強いですね。
english: Windy this morning, isn't it?

japanese: 今朝は浮かぬ顔をしているね。何かあったのかい。
english: You seem to be depressed this morning. What's the matter?

japanese: 今朝は非常に慌てていたので、テレビをつけたまま外出してしまった。
english: I was in such a hurry this morning that I went out leaving the TV on.

japanese: 今朝は特に寒い。
english: It is especially cold this morning.

japanese: 今朝は道路がぬれているから、昨夜雨が降ったにちがいない。
english: Since the road is wet this morning, it must have rained last night.

japanese: 今朝は電車が混んでいて空席が見つからなかったので、ずっと立ち通しだった。
english: This morning the train was so crowded that I couldn't find a vacant seat and had to stand the whole way.

japanese: 今朝は朝食を食べなかった。
english: I didn't have breakfast this morning.

japanese: 今朝は暖かいですね。
english: Warm this morning, isn't it?

japanese: 今朝は大変寒かったので、私はコートを着たままでいた。
english: It was so cold this morning that I left my coat on.

japanese: 今朝は体の調子がよい。
english: I feel good this morning.

japanese: 今朝は霜がたくさん降りた。
english: We had a heavy frost this morning.

japanese: 今朝は寝坊したので朝食をとる時間がなかったんです。
english: This morning I got up too late to have breakfast.

japanese: 今朝は少し熱がありました。
english: I had a little fever this morning.

japanese: 今朝は出かけたくない気分だ。
english: I don't feel like going out this morning.

japanese: 今朝は出かけたくない気持ちだ。
english: I don't feel like going out this morning.

japanese: 今朝は散歩したいような気がする。
english: I feel like going for a walk this morning.

japanese: 今朝は傘を持っていった方がいいですよ。
english: You should take an umbrella with you this morning.

japanese: 今朝は昨日の朝よりもずっと涼しかった。
english: This morning it was much cooler than yesterday morning.

japanese: 今朝は骨身にしみる寒さだった。
english: There was a keen frost this morning.

japanese: 今朝は空気が多少冷たい。
english: The air feels somewhat cold this morning.

japanese: 今朝は向こうの山が真っ白になっている。
english: Those mountains over there have turned white this morning.

japanese: 気分転換に今朝は外で食事しませんか。
english: How about eating out this morning for a change?

japanese: 今朝は気分はいかがですか。
english: How are you feeling this morning?

japanese: 今朝は気分が良いです。
english: I'm feeling good this morning.

japanese: 今朝は気温が氷点下に下がっている。
english: The temperature has fallen below zero this morning.

japanese: 今朝は顔を洗わないで学校へ出掛けた。
english: This morning, I left for school without washing my face.

japanese: 今朝は寒く感じる。
english: I feel cold this morning.

japanese: 今朝は寒いですね。
english: Cold this morning, isn't it?

japanese: 今朝は外気が冷たく感じる、もう冬が近づいている。
english: The air feels cold this morning; winter is approaching.

japanese: 今朝は何時に起きたの？
english: When did you get up this morning?

japanese: 今朝は何をしたの？
english: What did you do this morning?

japanese: 今朝は雨が降りそうだったが、良い天気になった。
english: Although it looked like rain this morning, it has turned out fine.

japanese: 今朝は一番列車に間に合うように４時に起きました。
english: This morning I got up at four so as to be in time for the first train.

japanese: 今朝は一生懸命に働きましたね、サイモン。
english: You've worked hard this morning, Simon.

japanese: 今朝はよいお天気なので、散歩に行きたいな。
english: It's fine this morning and I feel like a walk.

japanese: 今朝はバスがとても混んでいる。
english: The bus is very crowded this morning.

japanese: 今朝はひどく暑い。
english: It is terribly hot this morning.

japanese: 今朝はとても早く起きなければならなかったんです。
english: I had to get up very early this morning.

japanese: 今朝はとても寒い。
english: It is very cold this morning.

japanese: 今朝はとても寒かった。
english: It was very cold this morning.

japanese: 今朝はとてもうれしそうだね。
english: You look very happy this morning.

japanese: 今朝はするべきことがたくさんある。
english: I have a lot of things to do this morning.

japanese: 今朝はかなり暑いですね。
english: It's pretty hot this morning.

japanese: 今朝はコーヒーの代わりに紅茶を飲んだ。
english: I had tea instead of coffee this morning.

japanese: 今朝はいつもより１時間早く起きた。
english: This morning I got up an hour earlier than usual.

japanese: 今朝は５時に目を覚ました。
english: I woke up at five this morning.

japanese: 今朝は７時に起きた。
english: I got up at seven this morning.

japanese: 今朝は１時間早く起きた。
english: He got up an hour early this morning.

japanese: 今朝の電話のフォローアップとしてＥメールしています。
english: I'm e-mailing to follow up on our phone conversation this morning.

japanese: 今朝の地震は感じましたか。
english: Did you feel the earthquake this morning?

japanese: 今朝の新聞の社説を読みましたか。
english: Have you read the leading article in today's paper?

japanese: 今朝の気温は零下１０度であった。
english: It was ten degrees below zero this morning.

japanese: 今朝のテレビで、あなたの地域で大火災があったことを知り、驚いています。
english: From the telecast this morning, I have learned to my shock that a big fire hit your area.

japanese: 今朝のご気分はどうですか。
english: How are you feeling this morning?

japanese: 今朝に予定されていた打ち上げは、ジョン・クレイトン船長の病気のために延期された。
english: The launch, which had been scheduled for this morning, was postponed because of the illness of shuttle Commander John Creighton.

japanese: 今朝になってやっと雨がやんだ。
english: It was not till this morning that it stopped raining.

japanese: 今朝トムは彼の姉はまだ病気で寝ていると言った。
english: This morning Tom said that his sister was still ill in bed.

japanese: 今朝とても寒かったので、ジャケットを持って来ました。
english: I brought a jacket because it was quite cool this morning.

japanese: 今朝から本を３冊読んだ。
english: I have read three books since this morning.

japanese: 今朝から停電している。
english: The power has been cut off since this morning.

japanese: 今朝から雪が降り続いている。
english: It has been snowing since this morning.

japanese: 今朝から雨が降ったりやんだりしている。
english: It has been raining on and off since this morning.

japanese: 今朝、彼女はパンを１個買った。
english: She bought a loaf of bread this morning.

japanese: 今朝あの人が私に２冊の本を貸してくれました。
english: The man lent me two books this morning.

japanese: 今朝からずっと私は何も食べていない。
english: I have not had anything to eat since this morning.

japanese: 今朝、登校の途中で外国人の一団に会いました。
english: I saw a group of foreigners on my way to school this morning.

japanese: 今朝、陪審の件で呼ばれて陪審員をやることになったんだ。
english: I was called in for jury this morning, and I actually have to serve on a case.

japanese: 今朝、彼は昨日よりずっと身体の調子が良さそうだった。
english: He looked much better this morning than yesterday.

japanese: 今朝、朝食を食べましたか。
english: Did you have breakfast this morning?

japanese: 今朝、朝食を取っていたなら、今、空腹ではないだろうに。
english: If I had eaten breakfast this morning, I would not be hungry now.

japanese: 今朝、赤ちゃんが産まれたというすばらしいニュースを聞きました。
english: This morning, I heard the great news of the new arrival in your family.

japanese: 今朝、交通事故が起こった。
english: A traffic accident took place this morning.

japanese: 今誰から電話があっても、私は留守だと伝えて下さい。
english: Whoever calls now, tell him I'm not in.

japanese: 今生きているのは彼のおかげだ。
english: It is his favor to be alive now.

japanese: 今成田空港にいます。
english: I'm at Narita Airport right now.

japanese: 今世紀の終わりまでには、地球の気温は劇的に上昇しているだろう。
english: By the end of the century, the earth will have experienced a dramatic increase in temperature.

japanese: 今世紀には注目すべき知識の増加があった。
english: Our century has seen a notable increase of knowledge.

japanese: 今世紀が始まって以来、多くの進歩があった。
english: Many improvements have been made since this century began.

japanese: 今人気を呼んでいるもの。
english: What's currently hot?

japanese: 今人気の「おばあちゃんの食卓」に行ったことがありますか。
english: Have you been to Grandma's Table which is very popular now?

japanese: 今人気のある映画は何ですか。
english: What is the most popular movie now?

japanese: 今宵、奈落の王が復活する。
english: Tonight, the King of Hell returns.

japanese: 今出発すれば飛行機に間に合うでしょうか。
english: Will we be in time for the plane if we leave now?

japanese: 今出発すれば、時間に間に合うようにそこにつくでしょう。
english: If you start now, you will get there in time.

japanese: 今出発するのが好都合です。
english: It is convenient for us to start now.

japanese: 今出発しなさい、そうすればそこに間に合って着くでしょう。
english: Start now, and you will get there in time.

japanese: 今出発しなければ遅刻しますよ。
english: Unless you start now, you'll be late.

japanese: 今出発していいですか。
english: May I leave now?

japanese: 今出かける所なんですよ。
english: I'm leaving now.

japanese: 今出かけるのは無理だ。
english: It's impossible to go out now.

japanese: 今出かけるのには遅すぎる。
english: It is too late to go out now.

japanese: 今宿題をやってしまいなさい。
english: You should do your homework now.

japanese: 今出かけた方がいい。
english: You may as well leave now.

japanese: 今は十分な食料がある。
english: We have enough food now.

japanese: 今週末までにレポートを提出することになっている。
english: You are supposed to hand in the report by the end of this week.

japanese: 今週末までにはぜひその仕事を終えていただきたいのです。
english: We'd like you to finish the job by the end of this week by all means.

japanese: 今週末までいくらかお金を貸してくれませんか。
english: Could you lend me some money until this weekend?

japanese: 今週末は何も予定がない。
english: I have nothing on this weekend.

japanese: 今週末は温泉に行く余裕はないね。すっからかんだ。
english: I can't afford to go to the onsen this weekend. I'm broke.

japanese: 今週末は３連休だ。
english: We're having a three-day weekend this week.

japanese: 今週末に学んだ何か重要な事を話して下さい。
english: Tell me something important you learned this weekend.

japanese: 今週末、山に行くってのはどうかな？
english: Why don't we go to the mountains this weekend?

japanese: 今週末、何か計画はありますか。
english: Do you have anything on for this weekend?

japanese: 今週メアリーは期末試験の準備のために夜遅くまで起きている。
english: Mary is sitting up late this week to prepare for her finals.

japanese: 今週までにはそれを終えてしまいたかったのだが。
english: I hoped to have finished it by this week.

japanese: 今週は弁当を持参する。
english: I think I'll brown bag it this week.

japanese: 今週は非常に忙しい。
english: I'm very busy this week.

japanese: 今週は中間試験が３つ。
english: This week I had three midterms.

japanese: 今週は大いに書きました。
english: I have done much writing this week.

japanese: 今週は公園の桜が満開だ。
english: This week the cherry blossoms in the park are in full bloom.

japanese: 今週ハンバーガーが値上がりした。
english: Hamburgers have gone up this week.

japanese: 今週は火災予防週間です。
english: This is Fire Prevention Week.

japanese: 今週はよい映画が上映されてますか。
english: Are there any good films on this week?

japanese: 今週はたくさん物を食べた。
english: I've eaten a great deal of food this week.

japanese: 今週はどちらにいらしゃいましたか。
english: Where have you been this week?

japanese: 今週はずっと忙しいんだ。
english: I have been busy this week.

japanese: 今週はたくさんの人が休んでいたので、その企画を完成できなかった。
english: With so many people absent this week, we weren't able to complete the project.

japanese: 今週はずっと働いていた。
english: I worked all this week.

japanese: 今週はずっと働きづめだった。
english: I've been on the go all this week.

japanese: 今週はずっと大変忙しい。
english: I have been very busy this week.

japanese: 今週はずっと天気がよい。
english: We have had fine weather this week.

japanese: 今週はしなければならないことでいっぱいだ。
english: I've got a lot of things to do this week.

japanese: 今週の週末には何か約束がありますか。
english: Do you have anything on for this weekend?

japanese: 今週の終わりまでに宿題を提出してください。
english: You are supposed to hand in the homework by the end of the week.

japanese: 今週の終わりまでにやらなくては、いけません。
english: You must do it by the end of this week.

japanese: 来週の今日、私は英国にいるでしょう。
english: Today week I'll be in England.

japanese: 今週の金曜日は先約が入っていて、飲み会には行けないな。
english: I already have something planned for Friday, so I won't be able to make it to the drinking session.

japanese: 今週の映画情報を教えてください。
english: What movies are playing this week?

japanese: 今週あなたは何をしていましたか。
english: What have you been doing this week?

japanese: 今授業で何を習っていますか。
english: What are you learning at school?

japanese: 今は手が放せません。
english: I'm not available right now.

japanese: 今手が足りないのです。
english: We are shorthanded now.

japanese: 今手が塞がっているんです。
english: I'm busy now.

japanese: 今若ければなあ。
english: I wish I were young.

japanese: 今時、年功序列だなんて言っても、若い奴の反発を食うだけですよ。
english: If you try to defend the seniority-based corporate escalator these days all you'll get is flak from younger employees.

japanese: 今持っているお金はすべてお貸ししましょう。
english: I will lend you what little money I have now.

japanese: 今私は母親が人前で社交辞令をつかっていたにすぎないと理解しました。
english: Now I understand that my mother was only trying to be polite in public.

japanese: 今私はその手紙を身につけていません。
english: I don't have the letter on me now.

japanese: 今私の家の付近に住宅が続々建っている。
english: In my neighborhood, houses are now being built one after another.

japanese: 今私たちに必要なのは休養です。
english: What we need now is a rest.

japanese: 今私たちに必要なのは休息です。
english: What we need now is a rest.

japanese: 今始めましょうか。
english: Shall we begin now?

japanese: 今仕事から手が離せない。
english: I can't get away from work now.

japanese: 今桜は満開です。
english: The cherry blossoms are at their best now.

japanese: 今、最後の仕上げをするところです。
english: Now I'll add the finishing touch.

japanese: 今最善をつくせば、あなたに幸せがやって来る。
english: If you try your best now, happiness will come to you.

japanese: 今頃彼女はそこにいるだろう。
english: She will be there by now.

japanese: 今頃彼は万事休すだ。
english: It is all up with him by this time.

japanese: 今頃言うなんて遅いよ。事が起こった時に言わないと。
english: Don't come to me now with that. You should have said something when it originally happened.

japanese: 今頃ロンドンは寒いに違いない。
english: London must be cold now.

japanese: 今頃の時期はなだれに注意しなければならない。
english: You have to watch out for avalanches at this time of the year.

japanese: 今頃にしては暖かい。
english: It's warm for this time of year.

japanese: 今行くと、トムはテレビを見ているところでしょう。
english: Tom will be watching television if you visit him now.

japanese: 今更悔やんでも後の祭りだ。
english: It is too late to repent.

japanese: 今更そんなことを言った日にゃ、火に油を注ぐことになるだけだよ。
english: For you to come out and say that kind of thing now would just be pouring oil on the fire.

japanese: 今後旅行の際はぜひ当社をご検討ください。
english: Please consider us in the future for all your travel needs.

japanese: 今後気をつけなくてはなりません。
english: You must be careful from now on.

japanese: 今後何が起こるか分からない。
english: You never can tell what is going to happen.

japanese: 今後も永久にタバコをやめたのですか。
english: Have you given up smoking for good and all?

japanese: 今後もおつきあいいただけるよう願っています。
english: I hope we will be able to keep in touch.

japanese: 今後は時間通り来なければなりませんよ。
english: In the future, you have to get here on time.

japanese: 今後は私が気にとめていることを言うことにしよう。
english: From now on, I'm going to say what's on my mind.

japanese: 今後はもっと一生懸命勉強しなさい。
english: Study harder from now on.

japanese: 今後はお金にもっと注意しなさい。
english: In future, be more careful with your money.

japanese: 今後はおくれないようにします。
english: I'll try not to be late in the future.

japanese: 今後は、新事業創造による経済の活性化という観点から、国民のコンセンサスに基づいた早急な内圧型規制緩和が推進されなければなるまい。
english: Therefore, they cannot catalyze deregulation without "external pressure".

japanese: 今後は、よりよいサービスを提供させていただきます。
english: You can count on us for better service in the future.

japanese: 今後の税制改革では銀行業界に何の影響も与えないだろう。
english: The tax reform will not touch the banking industry.

japanese: 今後の研究は、海洋に関する一層価値のある知識が得られる可能性を高めてくれるだろう。
english: Further investigation will offer many opportunities to obtain more valuable knowledge of the ocean.

japanese: 今後の計画が申し分なく上手くいくことを願っている。
english: I hope the new plan will work out satisfactorily.

japanese: 今後どんな細部にも注意を払いなさいよ。
english: You must pay attention to every minute detail from now on.

japanese: 今後ともよろしくお願いいたします。
english: Please continue your favors towards us.

japanese: 今後ともご支援いただけますよう、よろしくお願いします。
english: I hope that you will continue to favor us with your support.

japanese: 今後とも、貴社と緊密なおつきあいをいただけますよう希望しております。
english: I hope that your future activities will expand our relationship with your firm.

japanese: 今後とも、お付き合いのほどよろしくお願いします。
english: We look forward to working more closely with you in the future.

japanese: 今後、生物学を専攻する学生の数は増加するであろう。
english: The number of students who specialize in biology will increase from now on.

japanese: 今後、あなたの仕事を手伝うようにしましょう。
english: From now on, I'll try to help you with the work.

japanese: 今言ったことをどうかご容赦ください。
english: Please accept my apologies for what I said just now.

japanese: 今言ったことは取り消します。
english: I take back what I said.

japanese: 今見ることからあわてて断定してはいけない。
english: Don't draw a hasty conclusion from what you see now.

japanese: 今肩慣らししているところです。
english: I am just warming up now.

japanese: 今絹にはわずかな需要しかない。
english: There is only a poor market for silk now.

japanese: 今月末までに、あなたはこの仕事を終えなければならない。
english: You are to finish this work by the end of this month.

japanese: 今月末に僕の家にきなさい。
english: Come to my house at the end of this month.

japanese: 今月末で会社をやめることにした。
english: I've decided to quit my job at the end of this month.

japanese: 今月号の発行は１週間遅れるだろう。
english: Publication of this month's issue will probably be delayed one week.

japanese: 今月は給料が多かった。
english: My salary was high this month.

japanese: 今月は暑かったが、今日は例外だ。
english: It's been hot this month, but today's an exception.

japanese: 今月は殺人事件が２件あった。
english: There were two murders this month.

japanese: 今月は黒字である。
english: We are in the black this month.

japanese: 今月は国際貿易見本市が開かれている。
english: We are having an international trade fair this month.

japanese: 今月は雨が多かった。
english: We've had a lot of rain this month.

japanese: 今月パリへ行く予定だ。
english: I'm going to Paris this month.

japanese: 今月の電話代見て、目が飛び出た。
english: My eyes popped out when I looked at my phone bill this month.

japanese: 今月の売り上げはよくない。
english: Sales have been off this month.

japanese: 今月の末で１０年間ここに住んでいることになります。
english: We will have lived here for ten years at the end of this month.

japanese: 今月の鉄鋼の生産は、先月より２％増になるだろう。
english: Steel production will increase 2% this month from last month.

japanese: 今月の生活費は先月よりかからない。
english: Living costs this month are lower than those of last month are.

japanese: 今月の終わりまで待ってください。
english: Please wait until the end of this month.

japanese: 今月の終わりまでには、この町で働く人の数は１０００以上になっているだろう。
english: The number of the people working in this city will be more than one thousand by the end of this month.

japanese: 今月の終わりに私の事務所に来なさい。
english: Come to my office at the end of this month.

japanese: 今月の収入は２０万円だった。
english: This month's salary was 200,000 yen.

japanese: 今月の家賃を払うのを忘れた。
english: I forgot to pay my rent this month.

japanese: 今月のお小遣いもう全部使っちゃった。
english: I've already spent all my pocket money for this month.

japanese: 今月いっぱいで今の仕事を辞めます。
english: I'm quitting my current job as of the end of the month.

japanese: 今月いっぱいここにいます。
english: I will stay here all this month.

japanese: 今月５日から時間表が改正される。
english: The revised timetable will go into effect on the 5th of this month.

japanese: 今君に言ったことは忘れてはいけない。
english: You must bear in mind what I've just said to you.

japanese: 今君に会いに行ってもいいですか。
english: May I come and see you now?

japanese: 今君が言っていることは以前君が言ったここと一致しない。
english: What you say now isn't consistent with what you said before.

japanese: 今勤務中です。
english: I am on duty now.

japanese: 今教育制度が見直されています。
english: The educational system is now under review.

japanese: 今泣きたい気分です。
english: I feel like crying now.

japanese: 今期、我が社の黒字はほぼ１０％増加した。
english: Our surplus has swelled by nearly ten percent in this quarter.

japanese: 今帰らなければなりませんか。
english: Must I come home now?

japanese: 今学期は本当に息切れした感じだわ。
english: I seem to have run out of steam this term.

japanese: 今学期は政治学を取っていますか。
english: Are you taking politics this semester?

japanese: 今学期はどんな教科を選択しますか。
english: What are you going to take this semester?

japanese: 今学期はとっている授業それぞれに教科書があるのでとても重いです。
english: I have one textbook for each class that I have this term, so it is very heavy.

japanese: 今学期はスペイン語を取っている。
english: I'm taking Spanish this semester.

japanese: 今学期、２つの試験がある。
english: We have two examinations during this term.

japanese: 今皆様方はアルプスの上を飛んでいるところです。
english: Now you're flying over the Alps.

japanese: 今回発売されたアルバムは、ストーリー仕立てになっていて力作だ。
english: Her latest album is a tour de force. It even has a storyline.

japanese: 今回私の目的地はパリです。
english: This time my goal is Paris.

japanese: 今回は特別な行事なんです。
english: This is a special occasion.

japanese: 今回は大目に見よう。
english: I'll let it go this time.

japanese: 今回は出席できません。
english: I can't make it this time.

japanese: 今回は見逃してくれよ。
english: Will you get me off the hook this time?

japanese: 今回は見逃してください。
english: Let me off the hook this time, please.

japanese: 今回は君の不注意を許しましょう。
english: I'll excuse your carelessness this time.

japanese: 今回はボブが勝ちそうだ。
english: This time Bob is likely to win.

japanese: 今回はその試合に勝てるかどうか分からない。
english: I am not sure of winning the game this time.

japanese: 今回はしくじれないぞ。
english: You cannot fail this time.

japanese: 今回はきみはうまくいくと思っていたのだけれど。
english: We had expected that you would succeed this time.

japanese: 今回はあきらめな。しょうがないよ。
english: Give up on this one. You're wasting your time.

japanese: 今回の旅行では、大自然に触れることができた感じがした。
english: I feel I was able to get back to nature on this trip.

japanese: 今回の旅行での出費は全部つけておくつもりである。
english: I'm going to keep track of all the expenses on this trip.

japanese: 今回の選挙は激戦で元大臣が何人も落ちた。
english: The last election was such a hot contest that several ex-ministers lost.

japanese: 今回の成果はひとえに彼の獅子奮迅の働きの賜物でしょう。
english: Our latest results are the fruit of his furious efforts.

japanese: この本はこの詩人の最高傑作の一つだ。
english: This book is one of the poet's best works.

japanese: 今回の事は公にすると今後の売り上げに影響が出るから、今回だけは許してやる。
english: Making this matter public would have an effect on our sales, so we're going to overlook it this once.

japanese: 今回の試験は非常に難しかった。
english: The last examination was very difficult.

japanese: 今回の経験は、今後の私の英語の勉強の仕方に大いに役立つだろう。
english: This experience will be invaluable as a way of improving the way I study English.

japanese: 今回の雨には放射能はない。
english: The rain is radiologically inactive this time.

japanese: 今回のプロジェクトが終わって、やっと一段落したって感じだね。
english: Now that the project has come to an end, I feel like I've finally come to a resting-place.

japanese: 今回のことであまり思い詰めないほうがいいよ。だれにでも失敗はあるんだから。
english: Everybody blows it once in a while. It's better not to obsess on it.

japanese: 今回で私は二度ニューヨークに行ったことになる。
english: I will have been to New York twice this time.

japanese: 今回だけ大目に見てください。
english: Let me go just once.

japanese: 今回だけは君の味方をしよう。
english: I will side with you just this once.

japanese: 今回だけは彼も本当のことを言ったようだ。
english: This time it seems as if he is telling the truth.

japanese: 今回だけは許してやろう。
english: I'll forgive you just this once.

japanese: 今回が最後の試合だ。
english: This is the last game.

japanese: 今回お手数をかけたことについて、いつかお返しをしたいと思っております。
english: This would be a favor, which I would be pleased to return at any time.

japanese: 今歌を歌っている少女をみなさい。
english: Look at the girl who is now singing.

japanese: 今夏の降水量は普通でなかった。
english: This summer we had an unusual amount of rain.

japanese: 今何処に住んでいますか。
english: Where do you live now?

japanese: 今何時ですか。私の時計は狂ってしまいました。
english: What's the time? My watch is wrong.

japanese: 今何時か分かりますか。
english: Have you got the time?

japanese: 今何を考えているかわかりますか。
english: Can you imagine what I am thinking now?

japanese: 今何をしているの？
english: What are you doing now?

japanese: 今何が流行っていますか。
english: What is popular now?

japanese: 今仮に突然目が見えなくなったら、どうしますか。
english: If you became blind suddenly, what would you do?

japanese: 今俺は新しい生活を楽しんでいる。
english: Now I am enjoying my new life style.

japanese: 今駅に着いたわ。
english: We just arrived at the station.

japanese: 今映画に行けますか。
english: Can you go to the movie now?

japanese: 今雨が降っている。
english: It is raining now.

japanese: 今雨が激しく降ってます。
english: It is raining hard now.

japanese: 今悪性の風邪がまん延している。
english: A bad cold is going about now.

japanese: 今や留学は大流行だ。
english: Studying abroad is very common now.

japanese: 今や有名店ですね。
english: The store is making a mark.

japanese: 今や別の規則を加える必要がある。
english: It is now necessary to add another rule.

japanese: 今や彼女を救えるものは君しかいない。
english: Nothing but your love can save her now.

japanese: 今や彼女のことを救えるのは君の愛しかない。
english: Nothing but your love can save her now.

japanese: 今や彼は大学生として通用する。
english: He still passes as a college student now.

japanese: 今や彼には何の生きがいもない。
english: Now he has nothing to live for.

japanese: 今や日本がその役割を引き受けなくてはならない。
english: Japan must take over that role now.

japanese: 今や男女の賃金を平等にするだけでなく、家事の責任も平等にすべき時である。
english: It is time not only to equalize men's and women's wages, but also to equalize responsibility for housework.

japanese: 今や大統領はレイム・ダックにすぎません。
english: Now the President is nothing but a lame duck.

japanese: 今や戦争は終わった。
english: The war was now over.

japanese: 今や就職したので両親から独立することができる。
english: Now that I have a job, I can be independent of my parents.

japanese: 今や時代との競争になった。
english: It was now a race against time.

japanese: 今や音楽家たちは歌の中に例えば人権や環境汚染のような問題までいれています。
english: Now musicians include issues such as human rights and environmental pollution.

japanese: 今やノート型コンピューターは弁当箱と同じくらいが一般的だ。
english: Now notebook computers are as common as lunch boxes.

japanese: 今やどの民族にも純粋な血といえるものはほとんどない。
english: There's very little pure blood in any nation now.

japanese: 今やっと始めたところです。
english: I have only just begun.

japanese: 今やっていることを少し根気強く続けなさい。
english: Have a little patience with what you're doing.

japanese: 今もし私が金持ちだったら、海外へ行くだろうに。
english: If I were rich, I would go abroad.

japanese: 彼は今もいい人だから将来もいい夫になるよ。
english: He's a good guy now, so he'll make a good husband in the future.

japanese: 今まで来客で忙しかったのです。
english: A visitor has kept me busy till now.

japanese: 今まで僕は外国に行ったことがないんだ。
english: Up to now I've never been abroad.

japanese: 今まで彼らは一生懸命働いてきた。
english: Up to now they have worked very hard.

japanese: 今、彼はずっと調子がよいようだ。
english: He looks much better now.

japanese: 今まで彼にあったことがありますか。
english: Have you ever seen him?

japanese: 今まで誰もその部屋へ入ることはできなかった。
english: No one has ever been able to enter the room.

japanese: 今まで誰にもそれは出来なかった。
english: No one has ever been able to do it.

japanese: 今まで人前で泣いたことのなかった二郎が、オンオンと泣き出した。
english: Jiro, who had never cried in front of anyone before, started bawling.

japanese: 今まで私たちは熟語をいくつ勉強しましたか。
english: How many idioms have we studied so far?

japanese: 今まで仕事を見つけることができません。
english: I have not been able to find a job so far.

japanese: 今まで慣れ親しんできた生活習慣を捨てると言うのは、本当に大変なことだ。
english: It's really hard to turn your back on your way of life.

japanese: 今まで一度も彼に会ったことはない。
english: Up to now, I have never met him.

japanese: 今まで一度も中国料理を食べたことがない。
english: I've never eaten Chinese food before.

japanese: 今まで以上にいっそう勉強に励みなさい。
english: You should study even more than before.

japanese: 今までヨーロッパに行ったことがありますか。
english: Have you ever been to Europe?

japanese: 今までベートーベンの「第九」を聞いたことあるかい？
english: Have you ever listened to Beethoven's "Ninth"?

japanese: 今までは「なーなー」で付き合ってきたけれど、今後は是々非々の立場で付き合うよ。
english: Up to now we've been taking a casual relaxed attitude toward our relationship but I want to start looking at us more critically.

japanese: 今までは、私は、幸運でした。
english: I have been lucky until now.

japanese: 今までの彼女の人生は苦難に満ちたものだった。
english: Her life has been full of trials.

japanese: 今までの人生を振り返って考えてみた後、私は目標を変える必要があると判断した。
english: After reflecting on my life up to now, I decided that I needed to change my goals.

japanese: 今までのところ万事うまくいっている。
english: So far everything has been successful.

japanese: 今までのところ彼は学校では仲良くやっている。
english: So far he has done very well at school.

japanese: 今までのところ半分だけ終わりました。
english: I've finished half so far.

japanese: 今までのところ我々は彼から手紙を受け取っていない。
english: We have not received a letter from him so far.

japanese: 今までのところ何の情報もない。
english: We have no information as yet.

japanese: 今までのところは彼女から何の便りもない。
english: I've heard nothing from her as yet.

japanese: 今までのところはよろしい。
english: It is all right so far.

japanese: 今までのところは、何ら結果を得ていない。
english: The old place has not obtained the result at all.
